issue.title: [MNT] Fix compatibility failures after sklearn 1.1.0 update, bump sklearn version bound to 1.2.0

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This fixes various incompatibilities of `sktime` with the recent sklearn 1.1.0 release:
* fixes #2631 by moving the private `_check_param_grid` (which broke at sklearn 1.1.0) from sklearn 1.0.2 to sktime
* fixes breakage caused by `DecisionTreeClassifier` of `sklearn` no longer accepting float for `max_depth`

This PR also moves the newly introduced upper sklearn bound to 1.2.0.

issue.title: [BUG]: Current pycaret-ts-alpha package installs incompatible version of scikit-learn

labels.name: time_series
labels.description: Topics related to the time series

repository.name: pycaret
repository.description: An open-source, low-code machine learning library in Python

issue.body:
### pycaret version checks

- [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported [here](https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret/issues).

- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret/releases) of pycaret.

- [ ] I have confirmed this bug exists on the develop branch of pycaret (pip install -U git+https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret.git@develop).


### Issue Description

scikit-learn just updated its package to version 1.1.0 and pycaret dosen't seem to be currently compatible with it but pypi package dosen't seem to enforce a version lower than this.

### Reproducible Example

```python
from pycaret.time_series import TSForecastingExperiment
```


### Expected Behavior

Importing with no problems

### Actual Results


body:
> @fkiraly Will this be an issue for sktime with python 3.7?

I don't think so, since if you want to install sktime on python 3.7, you end up installing 1.0.2, which still works with sktime, according to the CI/CD.

I.e., you can use future `sktime` versions with the highest 3.7 compatible version of `sklearn` still, you simply are locked in to `sklearn` 1.0.2 or less.

Sorry, it was a badly phrased question. What I really wanted to ask was whether sktime will support 3.10? Most of the dependencies in pycaret now support this (with the latest release of sklearn) except sktime, so just curious :)

issue.title: [ENH] Support Python 3.10

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
sktime cannot be installed in python 3.10 because the [pyproject.toml](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/pyproject.toml#L44) file lists python<3.10 as a dependency.


**Describe the solution you'd like**
We should let users install sktime in python 3.10. 

Related issue: https://github.com/alkaline-ml/pmdarima/issues/481
